item.title: Dave add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Dave add a quote by O. Henry
item.description: "Each of us, when our day's work is done, must seek our ideal, whether it be love or pinochle or lobster Ã la Newburg, or the sweet silence of the musty bookshelves." -- O. Henry

item.title: Dave add a quote by Eugene Field
item.description: "No book can be appreciated until it has been slept with and dreamed over." -- Eugene Field

item.title: Dave add a quote by Sharon Salzberg
item.description:
"It is never too late to turn on the light. Your ability to break an unhealthy habit or turn off an old tape doesn't depend on how long it has been running; a shift in perspective doesn't depend on how long you've held on to the old view.
When you flip the switch in that attic, it doesn't matter whether its been dark for ten minutes, ten years or ten decades.
The light still illuminates the room and banishes the murkiness, letting you see the things you couldn't see before.
Its never too late to take a moment to look." -- Sharon Salzberg

item.title: Dave add a quote by Kathleen Winsor
item.description: "Charm is the ability to make someone else think that both of you are pretty wonderful." -- Kathleen Winsor

item.title: Dave add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Stately, plump Buck Mulligan came from the stairhead, bearing a bowl of lather on which a mirror and a razor lay crossed." -- James Joyce
